lead_sponsor.agency: VA Pacific Islands Health Care System

clinical_study.source: VA Pacific Islands Health Care System

brief_summary.textblock: The study has two goals. First to develop a computer-based intervention meant to alter cognitive biases that contribute to ongoing PTSD symptoms. Second, we sought to pilot test the intervention in a small sample of veterans for feasibility and acceptability.

detailed_description.textblock:
Aim 1: Develop Attentional Bias Retraining protocol (Phase 1)
- 1.1 Computerized assessment & retraining programs
- 1.2 Procedures and measures
Aim 2: Implement in pilot sample (Phase 2)
- 2.1: Assess feasibility and tolerability
- 2.2: Collect pilot data to plan future studies
- 2.3: Efficacy estimates based on changes in response time to dot probe task

study_design_info.masking_description: The transition point from the assessment only version of the attention bias program to the retraining/ bias correction version was randomized at the participant level and occurred between weeks 4 and 7 of the 10-week study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline and Post-treatment (1 month after last training session)
primary_outcome.description: PCL-M assess the 17-cardinal symptoms of PTSD.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline and Post-treatment (1 month after last training session)
secondary_outcome.description: Attentional bias scores represent participants cognitive bias to orient towards trauma-relevant information more quickly than neutral information.

other_outcome.measure: Daily of PTSD symptoms, specifically hyperarousal and intrusive symptoms (nightmares, reenactments, and triggered and untriggered recall)
other_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline and Post-treatment (1 month after last training session)
other_outcome.description: Participants filled out daily symptom log nightly

arm_group.description: Each participant receives 12 sessions. The first three sessions are baseline (assessment only) sessions. The last four sessions must be treatment sessions. The attentional bias intervention starts randomly on sessions 4 - 8, and continues until the end of the 12 sessions.

intervention.description: Participants complete a computer-based intervention, which is designed to correct cognitive biases associated with PTSD by training to attend to neutral information rather than the trauma-related cue words.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participated in ground combat operations in Vietnam
- Scored 40 - 80 on PTSD Checklist - Military version
- Availability and willingness to attend 2x weekly computer sessions for 6 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active substance dependence
- Significant cognitive impairment
- Current and active suicidal or homicidal ideation

patient_data.ipd_description: There is no plan to share individual participant data
